statements.name: PROC TEXTCONCEPTSCORE
statements.description: The TEXTCONCEPTSCORE statement performs concept and fact extraction by using a compiled LITI model.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the input table that contains the documents to process.

arguments.name: DROPCONCEPTS=
arguments.description: specifies a list of primary concepts to remove from the output tables.

arguments.name: INMODEL=
arguments.description: specifies an input table that contains a compiled LI binary.

arguments.name: INPARSE=
arguments.description: specifies an input table that contains pre-parsed input documents. You should use a table that was created using the OUTPARSE= option in a previous run of PROC TEXTCONCEPTSCORE.

arguments.name: LANGUAGE=
arguments.description: specifies the language that is used in the DATA= input table. You can specify the name or the two-letter ISO 639-1 language code of a licensed language. By default, LANGUAGE=EN; this specifies the English language.

arguments.name: MATCHTYPE=
arguments.description: determines how to treat overlapping matches while applying the LITI model. By default, MATCHTYPE=ALL.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: returns all the terms that match any of the concepts.

arguments.name: BEST
arguments.description: returns only the match for the concept that has the highest priority setting.

arguments.name: LONGEST
arguments.description: returns the longest match for the concept.

arguments.name: OUTFACT=
arguments.description: specifies the output table to contain the fact match results information.

arguments.name: OUTPARSE=
arguments.description: specifies an output table to contain the results of parsing the documents from the DATA= input table.

arguments.name: OUTRULEMATCH=
arguments.description: specifies the output table to contain the rule match results.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: The ID statement names the variable in the DATA= table that contains the document IDs. This statement is required.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable in the DATA= table that contains the document IDs.

statements.name: INPUT
statements.description: The INPUT statement names the variable in the DATA= table that contains the text of the documents to be analyzed. This statement is required.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable in the DATA= table that contains the text of the documents to be analyzed.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: The OUTPUT statement specifies the output table to contain the concept match results. This statement is optional.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: specifies the output table to contain the concept match results.
